name: irremediably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is impossible to correct or cure: It seemed likely that the accident had irremediably damaged her brain. I opened the new book and was immediately and irremediably absorbed in it.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was a man with a one-track mind, irremediably convinced that his own way was the only way.He succeeded because he tapped into the fact that stupid people are irremediably stupid.The king was irremediably tarnished by his association with fascism.
